title: Value-Based Care: Yes, There Is Low-Hanging Fruit
description: Most have a broad set of responsibilities that span information systems management, infrastructure upgrades, health data security and patient engagement. Typically they are also challenged by overarching dynamics that characterize the healthcare industry, including the rapid pace of change, an uncertain regulatory environment, physician fatigue and burnout, an increase in data breaches, the consumerization of healthcare, an upsurge in mergers and acquisitions, and more.
body: Most have a broad set of responsibilities that span information systems management, infrastructure upgrades, health data security and patient engagement. Typically they are also challenged by overarching dynamics that characterize the healthcare industry, including the rapid pace of change, an uncertain regulatory environment, physician fatigue and burnout, an increase in data breaches, the consumerization of healthcare, an upsurge in mergers and acquisitions, and more.

title: KPMG survey finds 50% of health systems receive value-based reimbursement
description: Half of healthcare systems get some or most of their reimbursement under contracts that put them at risk for the cost and quality of care, according to a new KPMG survey. The results are somewhat more upbeat than a Modern Healthcare survey last June.

title: CMS announces additional mandatory bundled payments in cardiac care and the anticipated Track 1+ ACO model
description: CMS is moving full-steam ahead with the transition to value-based care. On Tuesday, the agency announced 3 new bundled payment models in cardiac care, an expansion on the Comprehensive Care for Joint Replacement Model, and the highly anticipated new track in the Medicare Shared Savings Program.
body: CMS is moving full-steam ahead with the transition to value-based care. On Tuesday, the agency announced 3 new bundled payment models in cardiac care, an expansion on the Comprehensive Care for Joint Replacement Model, and the highly anticipated new track in the Medicare Shared Savings Program.

author.name: Mark Heaney, founding partner, Get Real Health in Rockville, Md.

title: MACRA patient engagement cheat sheet No. 4: Patient engagement strategies for bundled payments
description: Bundled payment programs are a type of value-based care program that have become much more significant with the emergence of the Medicare Access and CHIP Reauthorization Act. For the first time, a bundled payment program, the Comprehensive Care for Joint Replacement initiative, is mandatory for some providers rather than just optional. CMS has signaled that this is the beginning, not the end, of mandatory payment bundling for specific episodes of care. Also, on the private payer front, payment bundling is rapidly gaining interest. Boeing and United Airlines have negotiated specific bundled payment programs with certain providers, and other private payers and large employer groups are doing the same.
body: Bundled payment programs are a type of value-based care program that have become much more significant with the emergence of the Medicare Access and CHIP Reauthorization Act. For the first time, a bundled payment program, the Comprehensive Care for Joint Replacement initiative, is mandatory for some providers rather than just optional. CMS has signaled that this is the beginning, not the end, of mandatory payment bundling for specific episodes of care. Also, on the private payer front, payment bundling is rapidly gaining interest. Boeing and United Airlines have negotiated specific bundled payment programs with certain providers, and other private payers and large employer groups are doing the same.
context: Read this article from Becker's Hospital review on patient engagement strategies for bundled payments, value-based care and MACRA.

title: Top 5 tips for combatting 2017 coding concerns
description: The calendar may say the ICD-10 transition is long gone, but practices still will likely feel its repercussions in 2017 in terms of payer requests, denials and the new code set's influence on value-based care. Looking to next year, practices should start being proactive with these coding opportunities now to consider how the following five factors will impact documenting, coding and billing for care
